result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

It is ordered the petition for review is dismissed.  The subject of a petition for review must be a final decision of the court of appeals.  In Interest of A.R. 85 Wis.2d 444, 270 N.W.2d 581 (1978). No such decision is present here.  The court also notes that it appears from docket entries that Mr Skamfer ir represented by counsel.  This court does not entertain pro se petitions for review from represented litigants.

Defendant Matthew C Skamfer in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Defendant Matthew C Skamfer in custody.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Bachman informs the court that DE has provided to guidance for sentencing so Atty has nothing to offer for recommendations.  State makes sentencing argument.  Atty Bachman states he believes days credit DE may receive.  DE makes his statement to the court.  Court orders DE removed from the courtroom as he is being very disruptive during sentencing.  Court will order on Ct 1 DE to WI Prison system for 3.5 yrs-1.5 Init confinement, 2.0 years extended supervision.  DE will have 233 days credit.  Ct 2-9 months county jail, Ct 3-90 days jail, all counts consecutive.  DE will pay CC, DNA sample, surcharge, no contact with the victim.

Defendant Matthew C Skamfer in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Defendant Matthew C Skamfer in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  8:50 preliminary matters addressed by the court.  Mr Skamfer would like to have a motion heard for recuse of Judge, believes that he filed a motion in 2005 in Dunn County that was heard by the Judge and denied.  Motion will be denied by the court.  DE/Atty will acknowledge receiving amended information, waive reading of the information.  Atty would like to have a few moments with his client.  Atty Bachman addresses the court as to discussion with DE.  DE addresses the court as to the motion.  Court addresses the motions and will deny all.  DE feels he is being denied the right to request substitution of Judge, just was informed Wednesday that Judge Stewart would hear the case.  Judge Stewart addresses DE as to respectful behavior that will be expected from him.  Atty Bachman has private discussion with his client.  Court will proceed, jurors will return to courtroom @ 9:35 AM.  Court calls the case, announces appearances.  Oath given to all jurors.  Twenty Jurors called to the box.  Jurors #744, 738, 732, 721, 706 excused by the court.  Jurors # 750, 734 failed to appear.  DA Rennicke addresses the jurors.  Atty Bachman addresses the jurors.  10:39 counsel makes strikes.  Twelve jurors selected.  Jurors not selected thanked by the court and excused.   Oath given to selected jurors.  Jurors excused @10:53 to jury room.  11:05 AM- Atty Bachman states Mr Skamfer would like to make further record on the issue of recusal of Judge Stewart.  Jurors return @ 11:10AM.  Court gives opening instructions to the jurors.  State makes opening statements to the jurors.  Defense will reserve opening statements.  State calls Brenda (Torres) Richter, oath given.  Direct by the State.  State enters exhibit number one and two. Number two received by the court, will be published to the jurors.  Cross by Atty Bachman.  Redirect by the State.  No recross.  Witness dismissed.  Court will recess for lunch @ 12:05PM.  Will return at 12:55PM.  
1:00PM Jurors return to jury box.  State calls Deputy Anthony C Engel, oath given.  Direct by the State.  Cross by Atty Bachman.  Question by juror presented to the court.  Court addresses question to witness.  State requests court receiving exhibit number one-court grants.  Jurors excused to jury room @ 1:19PM.  Mr Skamfer would like to testify, court addresses DE.  Court goes over DE's rights.  Mr Skamfer takes the witness stand, oath given.  Jurors return to jury box.  Direct by Atty Bachman.  Objection by the State, overruled.  Objection, question rephrased.  Answer from DE stricken from the record, not to be considered by Jurors.  Cross by the State. Redirect by Atty Bachman.  Witness dismissed.  Jurors excused to JR at 2:04PM.  
2:40PM back on the record, Court goes over jury instructions with counsel.  Jurors return at 2:58 PM.  Court begins closing jury instructions.  Closing arguments completed by both sides.  Jurors given final instructions.  Oath given to Bailiff.  Jurors to Jury room at 3:37 PM to deliberate.  Jurors return to box @ 4:12 PM with a verdict.  Jurors find DE guilty on all three counts.  State requests jurors polled.  All answered yes.  Jurors excused at 4:18PM.  State asks the court revoke any bonds.  Atty Bachman not requesting a PSI, states DE has substantial credit.  Court will order a PSI be prepared, requesting that this be prepared quickly and sentencing set in four to five weeks.
